intro: Cerasiocarpum maingayi, commonly known as the African starfruit or yellow starfruit, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the common starfruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it produces a distinctive, fleshy, yellow fruit that is edible and has a tart flavor. Cerasiocarpum maingayi is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
